title: (x) Levan's Catering logo script - Poppl Exquisit {Patricia}
content:
I'm trying to find the script font and hunting through the fonts I have on hand (over 3000) is taking too long. I know the "catering" part is Avant Garde, but the "Lavan's" part is such a commonplace script look that I can't think of any one font.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [levansample.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20111211112359/http:/typophile.com/files/levansample.jpg) | 32.57 KB |
author: cieldailes

comments.content:
Looks like Exquisit or Poppl something or other.

Yes, it's Exquisit I think - except that the ligature between the e and the v may have been done by hand - or is it open type?

[http://www.philsfonts.com/showing.html?sku=BQ900290X1P1&start=1](http://web.archive.org/web/20111211112359/http:/www.philsfonts.com/showing.html?sku=BQ900290X1P1&start=1 "http://www.philsfonts.com/showing.html?sku=BQ900290X1P1&start=1")
I'm not sure-- this is a tiny gif that the client wants us to recreate and spiff up a little, but wants us to keep that font. I'm waiting on a reply from them about what it is.

The font is Exquisit but you might have to make that ligature by hand (unless as I said above) there's an open type version that has it.

Here is the full alphabet - there's your L.

[http://www.philsfonts.com/detail.html?sku=BQ90029003P1](http://web.archive.org/web/20111211112359/http:/www.philsfonts.com/detail.html?sku=BQ90029003P1 "http://www.philsfonts.com/detail.html?sku=BQ90029003P1")
